result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taiwan R Edwards

records.addlTxt:
Called @ 2:47 - Should not have been scheduled for today. Should be tracking trial dates. Court takes no action.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant Taiwan R Edwards in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Taiwan R Edwards.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant quashed, bond reinstated. Case set for trial. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taiwan R Edwards not in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman for Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Taiwan R Edwards.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture and Hearing. Bond set 3-18-2022.

1:50 PM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taiwan R Edwards in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Taiwan R Edwards. 
Atty Uzowulu doesn't have all of the discovery and asks for more time. 
No victims. 
Status set for 9/6/22 @ 8:30am, 2560.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

2:37 PM - 64-06  Defendant Taiwan R Edwards in court. Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for and with Taiwan Edwards.  Attorney Sempf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Information in the file is identical to the Complaint.
Attorney Uzowulu acknowledged the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial reserved.

Adj. 2:41PM

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taiwan R Edwards in court with Attorney Tony Kim.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Called @ 2:05 p.m. Appearances made. Record by Atty. Kim who goes over the charges and penalties and requests preliminary hearing to be set. He is not requesting preliminary hearing within time limits. Court set preliminary hearing on 22CF157 with 2019CF219 to track. Court in recess.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BOND TO COVER 19CF219 & 22CF157
DEFENDANT MUST POST  $500.00 CASH - already posted
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Taiwan R Edwards appeared in court, Attorney Obi Uzowulu for Taiwan R Edwards appeared in court specially. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
